etymology.description: phonetic 𡳿 (→土/士) + semantic 又 (→寸, “hand”); original sense “to grasp, to hold”.
etymology.interpretation: Combines a hand element (又→寸) with a footprint-derived phonetic (𡳿→土/士), evoking the action of holding or managing. The graph later shifted in use to denote an office and, by historical extension, a Buddhist temple.

examples.chinese: 我们在山上的寺里烧香(我們在山上的寺裡燒香)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài shān shàng de sì lǐ shāoxiāng.
examples.english: We burned incense in the mountain temple.

examples.chinese: 这座古寺建于唐代(這座古寺建於唐代)。
examples.english: This ancient temple was built in the Tang dynasty.

examples.chinese: 他在寺门前拍照(他在寺門前拍照)。
examples.english: He took photos in front of the temple gate.
